text: William I, known as the Lion (1142 - 4 December 1214) was King of Scotland from 1165 until 1214. His time as ruler was one of the longest in Scottish history, he submitted to Henry II from 1174 until 1189, when he paid Richard I a sum of money to stop him submitting. == References == Category:Kings and Queens of Scotland Category:1142 births Category:1214 deaths Category:12th century in Scotland Category:13th century in Scotland
title: William the Lion
